Class Battle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Battle

  • public class Battle
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates a battle between a Monster and Player. Affects their health levels and maximum health.
    Version:
    May 29, 2018
    Author:
    , Period: 4, Assignment: ApcsFinalProject, Sources:

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.util.Queue<Monster> q
      A list of the upcoming monsters the Battle will involve.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Battle(Player p)
      Creates a Battle against a monster in the queue
      Battle(Player p, Monster m)
      Creates a Battle against a chosen Monster

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkEnded()
      Returns if the Battle is over or not
      void endBattle(boolean win)
      Ending battle and affects the Player depending on if they won or not
      Monster getMonster()
      Returns the Monster in the battle
      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the Player in the battle
      void monsterAttack()
      Monster attacks player and lowers the player's health Says the battle ended if monster atkDmg > player health
      void playerAttack()
      Player attacks monster and lowers the monster's health Says the battle ended if player's atkDmg > monster health
      void startBattle()
      Begins the battle.

      • Battle

        public Battle(Player p,
              Monster m)
        Creates a Battle against a chosen Monster
        Parameters:
        p - the player that fights in the battle
        m - the monster to face in the battle

        Creates a Battle against a monster in the queue
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • startBattle

        public void startBattle()
        Begins the battle.

      • endBattle

        public void endBattle(boolean win)
        Ending battle and affects the Player depending on if they won or not
        Parameters:
        win - true if the player won win and false if the Monster won

      • monsterAttack

        public void monsterAttack()
        Monster attacks player and lowers the player's health Says the battle ended if monster atkDmg > player health

      • playerAttack

        public void playerAttack()
        Player attacks monster and lowers the monster's health Says the battle ended if player's atkDmg > monster health

      • checkEnded

        public boolean checkEnded()
        Returns if the Battle is over or not
        Returns:
        true if the Battle is over and one side won, false otherwise.

        Returns the Player in the battle
